All three legal moves keep three escape options next turn, but RIGHT is risky because it actively contests the nearby apple and could lead to mutual death if the opponent also commits.

- Keep safe space and avoid direct contest for (5,3). Prefer to take uncontested apples (3,6 or the ones at x=8) or circle back for safer approaches.
- Maintain at least two non-neck exits each turn to avoid getting boxed by the enemy body segments.
